mission_brief.txt.content:
THE WHITE HAT TEST - RESPONSIBLE DISCLOSURE CTF
============================================

MISSION BRIEFING (Static Fallback)
=================================

Welcome, Security Researcher!

This is a fallback version of the mission brief.
The dynamic version with current session challenges should load automatically.

If you're seeing this message, there may be an issue with the dynamic loading.
Please refresh the page or contact support.

ðŸŽ¯ OBJECTIVES:
- Discover 7 security flags hidden throughout the system
- Use the integrated Challenge Tracker for flag submission
- Practice ethical security assessment methodologies

ðŸ“‹ FLAG SUBMISSION PROCESS:
1. Open the Challenge Tracker (top-right corner)
2. Select a challenge from the dropdown menu
3. Enter the discovered flag in the input field
4. Click 'Verify Flag' to submit for validation
5. Track your progress with visual completion indicators

ðŸ” EXPLORATION TIPS:
- Check configuration files (.bashrc, .env, config files)
- Examine log files and system directories
- Look for comments in source code
- Review backup scripts and scheduled tasks
- Analyze network configuration and SSL certificates

For detailed current session challenges, the system should automatically
load the dynamic mission brief with your specific randomized flags.

Security Team Lead
TechCorp Security Division

alias la='ls -A'

.hidden_notes.content:
Personal Research Notes
======================

Remember to check:
- Open ports and services (ss, netstat)
- Web directories (/var/www/)
- Config files in /etc/
- SUID binaries
- Log files in /var/log/

The company mentioned they use nginx on port 8080.

.profile.content:
# ~/.profile: executed by the command interpreter for login shells.

export PATH="/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin"
export USER="www-data"

.env.content:

SECRET_KEY=super-secret-key-for-flask-app
FLAG_4=WHT-ENV2{environment_variables_leak_secrets}
ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@techcorp.local
DEBUG=true

backup_script.sh.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Daily backup script
# Run: 0 2 * * * /home/admin/backup_script.sh
# WHT-BACKUP{backup_script_analysis} - Found in admin automation

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/daily"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d)

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p $BACKUP_DIR

# Backup web files
tar -czf $BACKUP_DIR/web_$DATE.tar.gz /var/www/html/

# Backup database
pg_dump techcorp > $BACKUP_DIR/db_$DATE.sql

echo "Backup completed: $DATE"

.bash_history.content:
ls -la
cat /etc/passwd
mysql -u root -p
# Accidentally typed password: admin123
# WHT-HIST{command_history_forensics}
find / -name '*.conf'
grep -r 'password' /etc/
sudo systemctl restart nginx
history | grep mysql
clear

login.php.content:
<?php
require_once 'config.php';

if ($_POST['username'] && $_POST['password']) {
    // Vulnerable to SQL injection - needs fixing
    $query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='" . $_POST['username'] . "' AND password='" . $_POST['password'] . "'";
    // This is a security issue - parameterized queries needed
}
?>

crontab.content:
# /etc/crontab: system-wide crontab
# WHT-CRON{scheduled_task_discovery}
SHELL=/bin/sh
PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin

# m h dom mon dow user	command
17 *	* * *	root    cd / && run-parts --report /etc/cron.hourly
25 6	* * *	root	test -x /usr/sbin/anacron || ( cd / && run-parts --report /etc/cron.daily )
47 6	* * 7	root	test -x /usr/sbin/anacron || ( cd / && run-parts --report /etc/cron.weekly )
52 6	1 * *	root	test -x /usr/sbin/anacron || ( cd / && run-parts --report /etc/cron.monthly )
0 2	* * *	admin	/home/admin/backup_script.sh

backup_script.sh.content:
#!/bin/bash
# System backup utility
# WHT-SUID{suid_binary_analysis} - Check file permissions

# This script has SUID bit set - potential security issue
if [ "$EUID" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "Running with root privileges"
    # Backup operations here
    tar -czf /tmp/system_backup.tar.gz /etc/ /var/log/
else
    echo "Backup requires root privileges"
fi

security_scan.sh.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Security scanning utility

echo "TechCorp Security Scanner v1.0"
echo "=============================="

# Basic system checks
echo "Checking for SUID binaries..."
find /usr -perm -4000 -type f 2>/dev/null

echo "Checking for world-writable files..."
find /var -perm -002 -type f 2>/dev/null

echo "Scan complete."

ctf_completion.txt.content:
Congratulations!
===============

You have successfully completed The White Hat Test!

WHT-COMPL{responsible_disclosure_complete}

Remember:
- Always follow responsible disclosure practices
- Document findings thoroughly
- Provide clear remediation steps
- Respect system boundaries and permissions

Thank you for participating in ethical security research!
